document_title: Stevens Johnson syndrome (SJS): Causes, signs, treatment
subsection_content:
Treatment of Stevens-Johnson syndrome includes: (4)
Immediately stop taking the medicine that causes the allergic reaction; Replace electrolytes with intravenous (IV) fluids; Use non-stick bandages on damaged skin; Use high-calorie foods to increase resistance to promote the healing process; Use antibiotics and antihistamines when necessary to prevent infection; Use pain relievers; Treatment in hospital/intensive care unit/burn room; The team of doctors involved in treatment may include dermatologists, intensivists, and ophthalmologists (in case of eye damage).; In some cases, treatment with IV immunoglobulin, cyclosporin, IV steroids, or amniotic membrane transplantation (for the eyes)
Patients should increase their intake of foods that increase resistance to quickly restore health
